p: However, several studies indicated that p-cymene can enhance the inhibitory effects of carvacrol when these two compounds are used together [ 58, 64, 65]. It was also shown that p-cymene, owing to its hydrophobic nature, greatly contributes to the cytoplasmic membrane swelling [ 61]. The findings obtained by Ultee, Bennik, and Moezelaar [ 61] indicated that p-cymene enabled carvacrol to be more easily transported into the cell. With respect to these findings, a slightly higher antibacterial effect of T. vulgaris EO obtained in this research could be accounted for by a slightly higher content of p-cymene.
